intro.p: For each of the following matrices, mark the entries where pivots should appear, and either label the matrix as in reduced row echelon form, or explain what should be done to put the matrix in reduced row echelon form and why.

outtro.p:
Is in reduced row echelon form
Not in reduced row echelon form because there is a non-zero entry above or below a pivot, which may be fixed by {{rowop}}.
Not in reduced row echelon form because the pivots are not descending to the right, which may be fixed by {{rowop}}.
Not in reduced row echelon form because a leading term has a value besides 1, which may be fixed by {{rowop}}.
